lexUnit.name: continue.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: persist in an activity or process.

sentence.text: ` In no way is it a finishing line , " said Hugh , who intends to continue working as long as possible .
The other player answers ` Smee " , and they continue searching .
The staff of the Unit continues largely unchanged , though we have been pleased to have had four postdoctorals associated with our activities over the past year or so .
The atmosphere was not exactly lively but I continued to have lunch there for a long time because she was extremely kind and the food was good .
All ambulance crews would continue to stand by at their stations for 999 calls .
Life is too short to continue hating anyone for a long time .
It continues to turn , moving now towards the Cabinet Office .
If we continue supplying the Reds , we will be helping them more than the Blues .
This chapter continues with the topic of monarchy , an issue about which British people can talk readily and lengthily .
We continue our drive towards Hollywood in silence , because there 's nothing else to say about Dudley Moore .
It says that Labour will " continue devolution of management to unions within health boards . "
The West Midlands continued to decline as a manufacturing region throughout the period , for instance .
The area is quite densely populated and the majority continues to be actively farmed .
Margaret continued to cope fairly well during the next year .
` However , we will continue to monitor the association very closely and will meet regularly with the ABA .
Until 1939 he continued to teach medieval history , giving tutorials that often lasted for a couple of hours .
The Agency would continue to encourage monthly direct debit payments from non-employed and self-employed contributors ( excluding share fishermen ) .
He continued to read voraciously throughout the 1790s , and there seems no reason to doubt Coleridge' s belief that Wordsworth was eminently equipped to write philosophical poetry .
